byline.original: By RICK ROJAS and AL BAKER

abstract: New York City Police Dept says officers who failed to realize Myrtle McKinney had stab wound in her neck, which led them to conclude 82-year-old died from natural causes, may face disciplinary measures.
lead_paragraph: The officers who responded to the death of Myrtle McKinney in November believed she had died of natural causes; a funeral director found a stab wound and other injuries weeks later.

headline.main: Officers May Face Discipline in Overlooked Killing of Brooklyn Woman
headline.print_headline: Officers Face Punishment After Missing Stab Wound

snippet: The officers who responded to the death of Myrtle McKinney in November believed she had died of natural causes; a funeral director found a stab wound and other injuries weeks later.

keywords.value: Office of the Chief Medical Examiner of the City of New York
keywords.name: organizations
